did.unittitle: Chemical Heritage Foundation staff files (Ted Benfey)

bioghist.p: In 1982, the Center for the History of Chemistry (CHOC) was launched as a pilot project of the University of Pennsylvania and the American Chemical Society (ACS). In 1987 CHOC was incorporated as a not-for-profit organization, now named the National Foundation for the History of Chemistry (NFHC), by joint action of the ACS and AIChE, the Center's third sponsor. In 1992 the Chemical Heritage Foundation (CHF) assumed its present name to better reflect the interdisciplinary nature of the sciences and industries it serves and the widening public scope of its activities. Ted (Theodor) Benfey is Emeritus Professor of Chemistry and History of Science, Guilford College. In 1988 Benfey became editor of Chemical Heritage newsmagazine.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of Benfey's editorial and reference files. Included are: articles and correspondence related to professional organizations, societies, and individual chemists; drafts of articles and announcements submitted to Chemical Heritage; ideas for future issues; queries about information or photographs from the collections of CHOC/CHF; CHOC newsletters and copies of Chemical Heritage (1983-1996); files on CHF projects and publications; 3-year progress reports for the NFHC; reference materials on chemical education programs; and miscellaneous reprints.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
